body:
### Problem

CMake 3.31 started to complain:
```
CMake Warning (dev) at cmake/Util.cmake:63 (add_custom_command):
  Exactly one of PRE_BUILD, PRE_LINK, or POST_BUILD must be given.  Assuming
  POST_BUILD to preserve backward compatibility.

  Policy CMP0175 is not set: add_custom_command() rejects invalid arguments.
  Run "cmake --help-policy CMP0175" for policy details.  Use the cmake_policy
  command to set the policy and suppress this warning.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:249 (add_glob_target)
This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.

CMake Warning (dev) at cmake/Util.cmake:63 (add_custom_command):
  Exactly one of PRE_BUILD, PRE_LINK, or POST_BUILD must be given.  Assuming
  POST_BUILD to preserve backward compatibility.

  Policy CMP0175 is not set: add_custom_command() rejects invalid arguments.
  Run "cmake --help-policy CMP0175" for policy details.  Use the cmake_policy
  command to set the policy and suppress this warning.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:260 (add_glob_target)
This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.

CMake Warning (dev) at cmake/Util.cmake:63 (add_custom_command):
  Exactly one of PRE_BUILD, PRE_LINK, or POST_BUILD must be given.  Assuming
  POST_BUILD to preserve backward compatibility.

  Policy CMP0175 is not set: add_custom_command() rejects invalid arguments.
  Run "cmake --help-policy CMP0175" for policy details.  Use the cmake_policy
  command to set the policy and suppress this warning.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:276 (add_glob_target)
This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.
```

This is not really a bug, rather a build warning. I came up with this patch
that I borrowed from evolution (linked below) but I'm sure developers would
be able to come up with a better and/or appropriate fix.

```diff
diff --git a/cmake/Util.cmake b/cmake/Util.cmake
index f09de78668..db7483782b 100644
--- a/cmake/Util.cmake
+++ b/cmake/Util.cmake
@@ -61,7 +61,8 @@ function(add_glob_target)
   if(NOT ARG_COMMAND)
     add_custom_target(${ARG_TARGET})
     add_custom_command(TARGET ${ARG_TARGET}
-      COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E echo "${ARG_TARGET} SKIP: ${ARG_COMMAND} not found")
+      COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E echo "${ARG_TARGET} SKIP: ${ARG_COMMAND} not found"
+      POST_BUILD)
     return()
   endif()
 
diff --git a/src/nvim/CMakeLists.txt b/src/nvim/CMakeLists.txt
index ae2a7c76ed..7582904398 100644
--- a/src/nvim/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/src/nvim/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -772,7 +772,7 @@ file(MAKE_DIRECTORY ${BINARY_LIB_DIR})
 
 # install treesitter parser if bundled
 if(EXISTS ${DEPS_PREFIX}/lib/nvim/parser)
-  add_custom_command(TARGET nvim_runtime_deps COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E ${COPY_DIRECTORY} ${DEPS_PREFIX}/lib/nvim/parser ${BINARY_LIB_DIR}/parser)
+  add_custom_command(TARGET nvim_runtime_deps COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E ${COPY_DIRECTORY} ${DEPS_PREFIX}/lib/nvim/parser ${BINARY_LIB_DIR}/parser POST_BUILD)
 endif()
 
 install(DIRECTORY ${BINARY_LIB_DIR}
```


https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/policy/CMP0175.html#policy:CMP0175

Please also refer: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/evolution-data-server/-/merge_requests/168/diffs?commit_id=0840398984dd7836f05ce9d1211f2b94934ab676

### Steps to reproduce

git clone https://github.com/neovim/neovim.git
cd neovim
git checkout v0.10.3
make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$HOME/.local/nvim

### Expected behavior

Builds without the "Cmake Warning"

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.3 Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1713484068

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not sure

### Operating system/version

Gentoo (but I guess it would be same for any Linux distribution with CMake 3.31 and above)

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.14.0

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

From git source

comment_data.body:
Already fixed in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31121.
Backport to release branch: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31734

Note that this fix will not be applied to v0.10.3, but v0.10.4 or v0.11.0 (whichever comes first)
